Reviews.Content: My first digital camera took good pictures and had an optical viewfinder in addition to the screen viewer.  Since I depend on being able to take quick shot pictures, I used the optical viewfinder all the time.  The only drawback was the high use of battery power.The next was a lighter weight camera, taking good pictures, but without an optical viewfinder.  I spent so much time framing the shot, that I missed too much of what I wanted.  The sunlight obscured the screen even though I added a shade.Then I got my first Canon.  It is a Canon PowerShot A580 with both optical and screen viewfinders.  It is fast, takes really good pictures and does not drain the batteries like the others.  It also takes video better than either of the first two.In January 2011, I read several reviews about the Canon PowerShot A1200 and knew right away that the improvements over the A580 where what I needed.  However, it would not be available until April.  I kept checking with dealers once a week about the availability of the A1200 as soon as it was released, but they did not have it.  After the terrible tragedy In Japan, I was afraid that the Canon cameras already produced and available in the USA would be sold out before I could get one.  When I saw Amazon had a silver one available, but not the black that I wanted, I ordered it at the price Canon had originally published.  (Several days later, Amazon had the black one available; however the silver was already in route to me.)  I used the Canon PowerShot A1200 for every kind of shot I had wanted to try as soon as it arrived.  For the amount of investment, it has the most capability for a non-professional camera, takes excellent pictures, very good HD (720p) video and is lighter than the A580.  I will use this for a long time, maybe until the HD video comes with stereo sound.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera with major battery problems.
Reviews.Author: Rockdoc "Rockdoc"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice sized little pocket camera that has some features that are desirable such as an optical view finder and the ability to run on AA batteries.  I bought it as a backup for my wife to take to England but because of the problems she had with it it never got used.  It constantly required batteries after taking only 4 - 6 pictures.  I tried batteries out of different packages and by different manufactuers to no avail.  Canon agreed to fix/replace it under warranty but it's an additional $6.00+ to ship it to them so you might want to consider that as part of the cost.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: RMaha
Reviews.Content: Canon maintains its good reputation with this camera. It has a viewfinder, unlike most point and shoot digital cameras these days. The lcd display shows grainy in low light conditions, but when the pictures are taken they're of great quality.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money on this camera!
Reviews.Author: T. L. Keith "T.L."
Reviews.Content: I purchased The Canon Powershot A1200 for a Christmas for this year.  It was meant for an everyday carry around in my wife's purse camera, so she would have something besides her cell phone to grab a pic she wanted to capture.  This camera is aweful, I really think the disposable cameras you can pick up at the drug store are better than this camera.  I don't know what the 5 star reviews are all about, I read them all and in my research thought this would be the perfect camera for the purpose it was purchased.  I was sure wrong, it feels like a toy camera in your hands.  It is made of plastic... yes plastic the knobs feel as if they could break off any second.  The pictures it takes are aweful very grainy and the color well there is no color it looks like they are black and white images.  I was very disappinted in this from Canon, they sure have gone down the drain. I have already ordered my wife another camera and it should be here this Wednesday, this one is going back today.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture quality for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mikhail Reytsman "mlr"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is not as little as some of the other offering on the market, but it packs a good lens a good sensor and a good picture processor.  Picture quality is simply amazing for something this inexpensive.  It also comes with a viewfinder and a built-in flash.  I like that I could use AA re-chargeables in it, but it can be a negative for some people who prefer a build-in battery.  If you are looking for something simple and light to carry around this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie
Reviews.Content: This camera fits the expression "You get what you pay for."  Seems it's always giving me the symbol to use a tripod to avoid blurring.  In fact, too many pictures do come out blurry, especially if I use the zoom, which doesn't provide much enlargement.  Also, things always seem farther away than they are.  Eventually, I may invest in a better digital camera, more like the far superior 35mm camera I still own.

Reviews.Title: Hate everything about it
Reviews.Author: Anon "Anon"
Reviews.Content: Terrible camera. The camera on my phone takes far better pictures.I wanted something on the cheaper end to take while I was traveling. Right out of the box, I knew this was not going to work. It takes way to long to process between the time you take a picture and the time the shutter goes off. The photos are blurry.Don't waste your money, for ~$50 more dollars you can get something that actually works. Trust me, save yourself some pain, be a little less cheap and buy something that actually takes pictures.

Reviews.Title: Good, simple camera
Reviews.Author: William D Harris
Reviews.Content: I bought this inexpensive model of Canon to take photos to send over the Internet. I am not a fancy photographer. I just want to take photos to send to friends. It is a Canon. That is a good reason to buy it. I also like that it has an optical viewer for sunny days that wash out the digital screen and I like that it uses easily replaceable batteries.

Reviews.Title: LCD Screen Failed on 2 Cameras in Less Than a Year
Reviews.Author: DZ
Reviews.Content: The camera works well for a point and shoot.  Two problems.  1 - Shots without flash and bright light are grainy.  This may/may not be true with other cameras.  HOWEVER, I have had 2 A1200's for work and one for myself.  The first was great.  The LCD on the next two failed in just less than a year.  Both covered by warranty, but it makes you wonder how many fail just after the warranty expires.

Reviews.Title: Take great pictures for the size and sturdily built enough to last.
Reviews.Author: Camodrake
Reviews.Content: Really like the quality of the pictures this camera takes and especially for its compact size. I'm not a photo hobbyist so I don't know what all the special tricks and ritual sacrifices needed to take a great picture are but the simplicity of this point and shoot camera makes taking photos good enough to frame easy for me.The other upside to this camera is that it's built like an old Nokia candybar phone. I've dropped it, accidentally tossed it, used it in the rain, and it still works great.

Reviews.Title: Review of Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: SS
Reviews.Content: I have a lot of trouble in bright sunshine seing through the screen and this is one of the few cameras that has a viewfinder.  I would not get a camera without one.  This a very simple camera to use, which is what I need

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Hopwood
Reviews.Content: I like the fact that this camera uses AA batteries instad of a rechargable battery.  I just carry extra batteries along all the time.  Remember that in digital photography, batteries are your film.  I a little dissapointed with the quality of the pictures but I only use this camera when we are doing other things and I just want to have a camera on hand incase we want a photo of someting or someone special

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: James L. Coleman
Reviews.Content: Takes excellent high resolution pictures; good video; acceptable sound.  Most situations can be met by using default settings; the price was right

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: david pearlman
Reviews.Content: The A1200, and it's newer model, the A1300, are two of a dying breed of ultra-compact digitals equipped with a view finder.  While most cameras offer only the screen display, which many people find more convenient, using the screen eats up batteries and washes out in the sun.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Robert Berkman
Reviews.Content: If you want a view finder, and don't want to spend a lot of cash, this will work. It's a pretty cheap camera, but you do get what you pay for. I would recommend it to someone that doesn't need a camera for work, just play!

Reviews.Title: Fits the Bill
Reviews.Author: RustyC
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera, I could keep with me and get those spur of the moments pictures.  Overall it has done this job very well, the only thing I wish it did better was to shoot animals like deer at 50 yards and bring them closer, but I guess you can't have everything in an inexpensive point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Jenna
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good. My photos are always bright and it seems, the pic is alive!!!It is a good choice if u wonna save ur money and have a good product.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: J. C. Dalio "Old guy lovin' life"
Reviews.Content: Well,This camera replaced my wife's Powershot A95 because the shutter button fell off and repairing the camera would cost more than buying a new one.I am not sure of the problems that previous posters have with the camera but here are my thoughts after using the thing for a while.Pros:I like the AA battery use because in a jam even gas stations carry AA batteries. This unit only uses two.My wife is the primary user of the camera and she is all about "point and shoot" not "what are the correct settings" type of user. This camera fits the bill.SD card is easy to remove and the door is fine.The view finder helps in bright conditions where you can't see the screenBigger screen makes reviewing pics easier.Cons:Some low light pics don't come out as well as I would like. without the flash the image can be blurry and with the flash, there is either washout of the subjects too close or the pic is flat looking. I think the older camera did a better job of image stabilization.All in all, it is a good little point and shoot camera. The only thing I would like better is if I could upload the pics directly to social media or at least email them directly like the smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Real good digital camera
Reviews.Author: Big AL
Reviews.Content: Real good digital camera, takes good pictures, especially pictures up close within 2 inches, I can take clear pictures of the fine print on the circuit breaker lables. It uses 2 AA batteries, use Alkaline batteries, the rechargable batteries do not put out enough voltage to last very long. I highly recommend this camera to anyone who needs an inexpensive camera that gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Small and mighty
Reviews.Author: RustyRoads
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced the Canon Powershot A80 I have had for a number of years. I keep this one in the Jeep all the time. The large screen is huge compared to the postage stamp size screen on the A80. The A1200 has a viewfinder and optical zoom which I required.  Good image size that can be cropped.  Good images from this new purchase. I also own several higher end Canon SLRs with an assortment of expensive glass. The A1200 is a good value and should give great service. Update: This camera died in a little over a year.....kinda sad now.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200 Digital Camera - Black
Reviews.Author: Just Someone
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a 9 year old... she's loves it!  I love watching her with it, she has so much fun!  The "heart" setting is great, it makes sure all the basic auto settings are on and locked.

Reviews.Title: Avoid if you have ever used a digital camera before
Reviews.Author: MysticJaguar
Reviews.Content: The images that come out of this camera are somewhat fuzzy, and lack in both dynamic contrast and a general ability to separate color hues.  I did some simple tests between this camera and a Canon Powershot A620 7.1MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom produced back in 2005.  Even at 12.1 MP, this camera does not produce as good images as the A620 at 7.1 MP.Unless you are giving this to a child I would not bother at all with it.  You could easily go with something like the Powershot A2300 or one of many (too many) Digital Elph and get something much better.It's a shame what Canon has done to the A-series after being so stellar for so many years. Not even the current Canon sx line is a worthy successor (and the sx230/sx260 also a disappointment).  An OPTICAL VIEWFINDER is REALLY important regardless of camera size.  I can see why so many folks like me with A-series cameras from years ago moved onto other brands like Panasonic.  Still, the Panasonic menus are getting old.  Canon has been updating their menus to be better.  But good menus and bad photos are not a good trade.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: Texrigger
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what we were looking for.  Good quality images, enough magnification, fits in my pocket, macro etc. Best of all it has a viewfinder feature that makes it easier to take pictures on sunny days.  We get a few of those in TX.  It's like having a mini SLR.

Reviews.Title: Dependable camera
Reviews.Author: F. Davis
Reviews.Content: I have purchase a few Canon cameras and have never been disappointed with any of them. I appreciate the continued good quality and dependability of Canon products.

Reviews.Title: I hope learning curve will help
Reviews.Author: Li P "Alias "Carole Jones""
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a week.  My first pictures came out reddish using the "Auto" mode so I better learn how to set the camera up manually.  I had to print out the guide which is 181 pages!  Also the movies extension is .MOV.  It will only play back pics and video through a PC and not through my HDTV or bluray player.  I wonder if most of these newer cameras are the same which makes me upset!  The one feature I wanted was the ability to use AA batteries which it does but still does not make up for it's short comings. I have grandchildren and used the motion detection setting and although the kids were not moving fast, the picture still came out blurred.  I'm thinking of returning this camera.  The focus is great and macro works excellent when taking pics of very small things close up if that's something you feel is important, however, this camera is not the greatest for my purpoes.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Photos
Reviews.Author: Queen Mother
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how nice these photos are!  I chose this camera for it's LOW PRICE, small size, AA alkaline batteries, and viewfinder.  I didn't need an impressive Megapix or zoom and I definitely didn't want to rely on a charger!  This camera had to be easy and portable to capture family moments.I am surprised how easy it is to take beautiful photos.  Especially in motion!  We were finally able to capture my son in action playing baseball.  I still haven't read the manual yet to understand everything but haven't needed it.  If you've used a digital camera before and have the general understanding you will be up and running pretty quickly with this!Now I am hoping it lasts!

Reviews.Title: Still a good buy
Reviews.Author: MGprincipal
Reviews.Content: Obviously there are many newer models out there, but that's why the price on the A1200 has come down.  I needed a new easy-to-use camera, and this one does the trick at the right price.  I get decent video - not overly impressed with the "720 HD" quality, but it suits my needs.  I would recommend this camera if you can get it for about $70.

Reviews.Title: It takes Photos!
Reviews.Author: N. Beamer "Hison"
Reviews.Content: As someone who takes a lot of photos of their artwork this definitely does the job, it's decent but at least it works.The good thing about it is that it's easy to use. It has a good flash and it doesn't take forever for the picture to load on the view screen.The bad thing about it is the gain that's everywhere on the videos.

Reviews.Title: good selection/purchase after looking at lots of reviews
Reviews.Author: Robert Gross
Reviews.Content: I have only had it for a few weeks, but wanted good resolution in close-up low light pics, which I find does the job well, despite the common complaint that the flash is set too near the lens, thus obstructing/blacking out a corner of the pic in very close object pics.

Reviews.Title: great little camera - Canon PowerShot A1200
Reviews.Author: lysdep
Reviews.Content: I almost bought this camera at an office supply store...but save over $30 by ordering on line.  It got here before the wedding and in less time than delivery could have taken.  I'm still learning everything about it...but pics are great andit fits ever so nicely in my purse!!  Love It.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200 is perfect for what I need.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to learn to use.  The pictures are clear and the automatic focus (day or night light) is great. I believe anyone who just needs a camera for every day photos will find this one as good as any other in it's price range.

Reviews.Title: Perfect point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Graphic Designer
Reviews.Content: Purchased for a trip to Haiti, I wanted a simple packable camera. Canon Powershot  A1200 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom (Silver)I got it in the Canon Powershot A1200! Loved the simplicity of use, the face finding feature, and the overall clarity of photograph. Small enough to fit in my small handbag, adequate digital "muscle" for clear face shots of the women I met along the way. Great economy of battery need, ability to choose which type of file size to shoot with. It is the perfect companion for the Canon Digital Rebel XSi 12.2 MP Digital SLR Camera with EF-S 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 IS Lens - Black intended as a future purchase. I would buy this again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Pics
Reviews.Author: Donna L. Ocha "MARTINO"
Reviews.Content: To keep things short and sweet. Great buy, beautiful clear picture. What more could be said. If there is one product, Canon is at the top of the list. I now have great pictures of my grand kids, and it was never easier. Sure am glad to have bought this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: A. Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived packed well and in perfect condition.  The body of it was a plastic composite and felt a little light.  After loading the included AA batteries I fired it up and ran it through an image and video test.  Absolutely gorgeous pics and videos for a camera in this price range. Reasonably fast recovery and pretty simple controls.  The best part is no proprietary battery.  It's really frustrating being out in nature and some funky battery runs out of power- no problem here!  Grab a couple AA batteries virtually anywhere and keep shooting.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas O'Neill
Reviews.Content: This camera has a viewfinder and uses 2 AA batteries, two of the "must haves" for me. If you try to use one without a viewfinder in bright sunshine, you will know why. And if you let your battery run down, you just need to find almost any store to solve that problem.And it takes great photos. In macro mode, I can almost fill the frame with my watch. Even in low light, it does well without the flash. So far, I have not found anything wrong with this camera. It did run through the included batteries rather quickly but I am still using the first pair of ni-cad rechargables (on one charge) after taking hundreds of shots while testing this new camera.The price is so good that I am thinking of getting a spare, as finding a small P/S with an optical viewfinder is becomming more difficult.

Reviews.Title: I expected a lot from this camera, and it delivered.
Reviews.Author: S. Shields "FSS"
Reviews.Content: When i learned i was moving to NEW ZEALAND i decided i had to get a camera soon. After looking, i decided the Canon A1200 Powershot sounded good, and for only $99 (Price when i bought it at least.) Which was great. The Camera is awesome. Takes brilliant pictures, and that was put to the test in New Zealand. Battery life is great, even on blinking "Replace Battery" light, it still takes days of light use to die. It has plenty of features, modes, etc. So if you need something simple or something a little advanced too, for a great price, this is for you. I suppose it's kinda big for a digital camera, when i could have bought a smaller one for slightly cheaper, but hey, this thing is worth it. Of course, dont get me wrong, its not perfect, ive had a few isolated issues with it, but nothing bad, at all. It takes great Macro (Close up) pictures. i took a picture of a keyboard and it showed like, every fiber and spec of dirt on the white keys. Brillian camera. The only person who might dislike this would be a professional (Or more experienced) photographer who'd be willing to shell out upwards of $500 bucks on a cam. But for average people, and even people who need a camera for frequent use, this camera is nice. I take it with me everywhere. I do NOT regret buying this.I hope i did okay on this review, i rarely review things.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: 19HLB48
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a Point and Shoot camera, with a view finder, which are getting hard to find.In bright sunlight it can be hard to frame your picture on the LCD viewing screen. This camera had all the features I need, and more than you need if your just a casual picture taker. So far it has performed beyond my expectations, and very easy to operate. I would recommend it to anyone just wanting a very good camera to take pictures without a lot of settings to worry about.

Reviews.Title: Found a good small camera with a view finder - Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Great little camera with a view finder.  Here in Arizona, I find that I cant see the screen when I am outside in the sun.  This is a great little camera with good color and resolution.  Glad I cam across it.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: holly.hill55
Reviews.Content: I am not a photographer by any means and I have wanted a digital camera for a long time. This camera had all of the necessary specs I was looking for, records very good video, takes nice quality pictures and works perfectly for my day to day use. I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great value for us "snapshot" folks
Reviews.Author: Steve K.
Reviews.Content: While I just purchased the A1200 and have taken a limited number of pictures, I am very satisfied with the compactness and capability.  The pictures I have taken involved flash, extreme close-ups, people and landscapes.  The major reason for the purchase was the optical viewfinder - the LCD on our other camera was impossible to see on many sunny days.This is an excellent value camera for a new user or second,third camera - for those of us who take "snapshots".  Your photos can always be enhanced on Picasa and similar products.Very well satisfied.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for kids
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: This Canon Powershot A1200 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom is great for kids to user.  It takes very high quality photos and videos.  Light weight and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Good point and shoot WITH a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: JPGsky
Reviews.Content: Nice point and shoot camera although the "shutter" button requires a lot of pressure to take the picture.  Haven't had it out for a trip yet (primary purpose is just happy snaps) but it seems to do what I want it to do.  AND it HAS a viewfinder.  I hate my wife's Olympus point and shoot because half the time you can't see the screen well enough to figure out what you are pointing at. First one I received the screen didn't work.  Returned it to Amazon and received a replacement within 4 days.  That was nice.  Little hassle, but there shouldn't have been any.--UPDATE--Have had the camera for a little over a year.  Have really learned to love this camera.  You have to spend a little time learning which settings work best in what environments (bright or low light, still or fast action) because they are not intuitive.  But once you know what works it takes really good pictures and videos (note for reviewers denigrating video quality: Buy a dedicated video camera).  And at a price that is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: kinnik
Reviews.Content: It is necessary that I have a view finder, which severely limits choices on compact digital cameras.  This one is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1200
Reviews.Author: Max Riedlsperger
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a handy supplement to take along when Rebel T1i is too big to lug, as on the golf course, to restaurants, etc.  I chose it because it is the only point and shoot that I could find that has a viewfinder.  I hate taking pictures using the LCD and turning that off provides for much longer battery life.  The fact that it uses 2 AA batteries is also a plus.  Years ago I had an early digital point and shoot that used AA's.  When it ran out of juice at the top of Glacier Point in Yosemite, I was able to go the the concession stand and buy some. If I had been using a camera with a rechargeable battery, there would have been no pictures.I also like the option that permits me to chose an ISO up to 1600.  This should make possible photos in dim available light.  So far, I have not been happy with the pictures I have taken with the flash.  They have been too light.  I need to study further how to deal with this.

Reviews.Title: Good for price
Reviews.Author: Shawn Bequette
Reviews.Content: Doesn't take great pics and flash takes a little long to charge but pretty good for the price point. My older cameara has much better opticts but is about 3 times the price

Reviews.Title: Canon A1200
Reviews.Author: JAMES O'NEILL
Reviews.Content: We have five Canon A620 series cameras that are used in our business. Have never had any issues until an A620 simply quit working recently. This new A1200 is substantially smaller and lighter but part of that is that is only utilizes 2 batteries rather than 4. Downside is recovery time between shots. With the 4 battery cameras the recovery is almost instantaneous, with the A1200 there is a 5-10 second delay that I find painful; otherwise this appears to be an adequate and functional unit. (also probably not entirely fair to compare this $89 camera with its $400+ predecessor).

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: Van Drake
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pictures, decent video, not bad for the money. The one small drawback is the short battery life. I used quality alkaline batteries, two AAs, and they were shot after a few dozen pictures and one 3 minute video. I'm going to get rechargable batteries.

Reviews.Title: Worth every dime
Reviews.Author: Lloyd H. Brown
Reviews.Content: The main reason I bought this camera was the fact that it has an optical viewfinder. For reasons I can't fathom, camera makers insist on making point-and-shoot cameras that force you to use the LCD, which I hate and refuse to use. Even the old 4 x 5 Speed Graphic film cameras had an optical viewfinder. Couple it with the 12 megapixel capability, petite size, many features for filtering, etc., and the incredibly small price (I paid $5 more than the current price) and it is a clear winner as far as I'm concerned. I have a DSLR if I want to get serious but I can carry this one anywhere and get excellent results. I have a photo in the gallery, wherever that is. I thought when I uploaded it would attach to this review but obviously I did something wrong.

Reviews.Title: Just as I expected
Reviews.Author: Anita
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for only about a month so far, but I love it!!!  My other camera was a Kodak Easyshare, which worked great for many years, until it quit.  This replacement cost me less than the Kodak from way back when.  The pictures look great!!  It is very easy to understand the instructions, and to use the computer programs for editing, etc.  I am thrilled!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A1200
Reviews.Author: Richinfamily
Reviews.Content: I made 150 pictures on this camera and then both the screen and actual pictures became very blurred.  I am sending it back for repair - much too early to need repair.

Reviews.Title: Good entry level camera
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our 9 year old and its about perfect for her.  Does a very nice job for a 9 year old photographer, is nice and compact, and didn't break the bank.  Love that it uses AA batteries which is getting harder to find.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera is a winner
Reviews.Author: M. McClain
Reviews.Content: I like Canon cameras...from point and shoot to SLR's.  I'm a Canon guy.  This was for my daughter, wanted not expensive, pocket-sized and hi-quality.  Was able to meet all three requirements.  Great price, great camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: T & S
Reviews.Content: Nice picture....Take some getting use to because you have to hold down button hard to take pix.  Fun with different lens effect.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: rmcing "rmcing"
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by its ease of use and the fact that it also took videos. Easy download to computer and or storage media.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: David Garcia
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, easy to use, the only problem is batteries don't last and it gets very hot while you are shooting video

Reviews.Title: Great Replacement Canon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After many years our previous Cannon died.  Since we were pleased with the last Canon Camera we went looking for another Canon.  The main feature we wanted was a REAL Viewfinder, not just the screen.  In crowded spaces the viewfinder is essential, as well as almost always guaranteeing a crisp shot!  Price is great and loaded with features, even though my wife will only use it in "Auto" mode.

Reviews.Title: A1200 is OK
Reviews.Author: jns
Reviews.Content: The A1200 is just what I wanted; a point-and-shoot with an optical viewfinder at a veryreasonable price.  I am not thrifty, but I wanted a camera that I can keep on handwithout worrying about damage or loss.The pictures are pretty good--this is a point-and-shoot after all.  The resolution noticeably betterthan my wife's Droid and it is slightly better than my old Olympus with 2.1 MP.  Meaningthat pixel count ain't everything.  The files are huge--like 2-3 megabytes.The controls are easy to use.  It has seven knob-selectable shooting modes, like "auto", "scenes""live" and more.  This is not really good; I cannot always remember what each mode is for.  The 196-pagemanual is on disk, so if you are in the field and really need the "toy camera" setting you may beout of luck. On the other hand you could carry a real toy camera as a backup.The viewfinder is adequate, but barely.  The screen is only so-so.I am satisfied with the camera and would recommend it to a friend who wanted a point-and-shoot.

Reviews.Title: unhappy
Reviews.Author: mountain princess
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this product because i had it for less than a month and while at my granddaughter's First Birthday Party, the screen went black and I could not take any pictures.  The product was faulty and had to be returned.  Because it was a third party purchase, I could not get a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Gops
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a second handy camera in addition to an SLR. It scores well in terms of picture and video quality, ease of use and size, however, zoom is quite limited and the shutter lag is quite frustrating.. The moment of capture is long gone when the camera finally decides to shoot..

Reviews.Title: GREAT SERVICE AND PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Rocker
Reviews.Content: FAST DELIVERY FROM SELLER, AND AMAZON CONTINUES TO PLEASE.SO FAR WE HAVE HAD GOOD SERVICE WITH THIS PRODUCT AND THE CANON LINE IN GENERAL. EASY TO USE NO BRAINER, AND TAKES VERY GOOD PICTURES FOR IT TYPE OF POINT AND SHOOT.

Reviews.Title: Definite winner/must buy!
Reviews.Author: Iliana
Reviews.Content: Great little camera!  Many neat features but easy to use.  Especially love the viewfinder (hard to get in many cameras these days)so both preview features make for easy use and better pics.  Can't beat it for the price and features.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: skipife
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, very handy, easy to always have with you.It has a view finder that lets you frame your shot, even on sunny days, most cameras in this price range only have a view screen and that uses up batteries.It is loaded with features you would expect to find on more expensive models, another plus, it uses AA batteries, so you can always have extras just in case.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Yogini Gram
Reviews.Content: The camera takes great pictures. Almost as good as my expensive one. The lag time is much faster than I expected. I suggest that you get the better memory card. I like that I can get batteries anywhere and I do not have to recharge to use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200 Review
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: This little guy does everything I wanted it to do, and so far, seems to have more features than I would normally use.  Everything works well, and I am very pleased with the overall quality of the product.  It is an exceptional value for the money.  I would recommend it for most casual and intermediate level users that want a very nice point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: canon Powershot a1200
Reviews.Author: jomar
Reviews.Content: Pro:  Camera performs well.  Picture quality is good.Con: Battery door is loose, may fail soon with use.  Adorama should revise packaging for shipping.  On corner of package was crushed during shipping.  Did not seem to affect camera.

Reviews.Title: Best Digital Camera under $300.00
Reviews.Author: Ron K.  Smythe "Ron K. Smythe"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Absolutely awesome photos and great HD videos w/ sound.  Super value.  Works on 2 AA batteries. Optical viewfinder.Cons: Small and slippery, don't drop it.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ken
Reviews.Content: I replaced an old 2.0 Mega pixel Kodak with this. TWO features were most important in choosing the Canon A1200; optical viewfinder and the use of AA batteries.So far I love the camera, it feels sturdy, and yes I dropped it once already. No damage. Of course it is far advanced over my old camera but still relatively easy to use.Here's a link to some video I shot with it.[...]

Reviews.Title: Mighty Mite
Reviews.Author: CA Bookworm "California Bookworm"
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised with the quality of pictures we get with this camera. The closeups are amazingly clear and sharp. Love the color clarity, which can be adjusted by the number of pixels you choose to use. It's light weight and easy to carry along in a pocket or purse. I would recommend that you buy the little carrying case otherwise you're going to scratch your camera from frequent use, and you will use it. A tripod, if you don't already have one, is another good accessory to have on hand. You get a lot more features and quality than you would expect for a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: L. Quintero "MrNoLove"
Reviews.Content: For close to 100 dollars, I expected low quality pictures; however, to my surprise, KAPOW! There were some really good ones. It has multiple settings and it's easy to use. I would highly recommend this camera if you're on a budget and want something good.

Reviews.Title: Focus died on me only after 6 months
Reviews.Author: Foong-ling Ting
Reviews.Content: OK, so I bought this camera for my teenager son after reading rave reviews and doing some research. It took ok pictures the first month Then 3 months later, I notice that the pictures get slightly blurry, like a handshake. At first I thought my son wasn't holding it steady when shooting.Then 6 months since we bought it, the images not only blur out, they bleed -- like they were sprayed with water and the images ran down like watercolor. The camera was never dropped, never mistreated. My family owns a Fuji, a Kodak and a Nikon. Never had any issues with them. And now Cannon -- this one totally sucks. Thankfully it was still under warranty and it is now shipped out to the workshop. Am still waiting for my replacement. I am very disappointed with Cannon. You are supposed to rank top, but now you are even below that of Kodak. Their customer service is wonderful...but I would rather have a reliable camera that does its job when it is supposed to. Needless to say, my son lost many memorable moments at camp because his camera failed to do its job!!!

Reviews.Title: In The Market
Reviews.Author: M. Stewart
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have yet to purchase this camera.  The reason I am adding a note here is because of the extremes in the reviews.  How can a camera that some see as the best thing since sliced bread be such a dismal product for others?  There has to be some user issues here, or perhaps in-experience in point and shoot cameras or photography as a whole.  This makes it very hard to reach some sort of viable conclusion as to a true rating of this product...

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: vuk
Reviews.Content: Well, This is a decent beginner camera, it has a couple of options to play with. I have played around with the cameras settings and come to find out the only way this camera functions properly is on LIVE mode. I have come to find out if the camera is on any other setting I get grainy, poor quality images.The camera is easy to use, it comes with a usb cable so you can upload your pics to your pc easily. It does not come with a storage card though...I'm not sure if I have a defective product or what not, but why would Canon give you all these different settings if only one works properly? I don't get it but whatever, it does take decent pictures on LIVE mode but thats about it.

Reviews.Title: Bad out of the box
Reviews.Author: Guy A. Edson
Reviews.Content: This was bad right out of the box.  The LCD screen showed distorted and abstract images and the photo's looked the same.  I sent it back for a refund immediately.  I noticed that one other reviewer had the same problem.  For those of you that got a good one, congrats.  Nevertheless, This is a very cheap camera -- unlike the usual high quality of Canon.  It is very light and very plastic.  It feels like a toy.  I have an A1100is and an A630 Powershot -- both high quality.  I bought this camera as a gift because of the "old fashioned" view finder (which in reality is extremely helpful in composing and holding the camera steady.  I guess I will instead give my wife my A1100is since new ones are now over $300 -- if you can find one.

Reviews.Title: not worth it
Reviews.Author: mcmissyWV "Missy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is ok for outdoor pictures with good lighting but don't get it for indoor events.  The "smart" camera won't focus or sometimes even take the shot if the ligting isn't perfect.  Frustration set in quickly and though I usually trust Canon brand.... I hated this camera.  I do understand it is a low end camera... I have nicer ones I didnt want to risk taking certain places... but this is lower than the other low end cameras for the price.  The packaging was fine and I did receive it in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Company
Reviews.Author: Ariel Aldirch
Reviews.Content: I recived this product from YourDeal.com, After opening this product we realized that it was a defective camera. I was so upset because I got this as a aniversary gift for my fiance. After contacting the seller we recived an email saying they would replace the product. After we sent the product back within 2 weeks we got the same broken camera back a month and a half later. I contacted the seller again about the defective camera and how they sent us back the same broken camera, along with the waranty information taken out of the box, they said that it was over 30 days after I recived the camera the first time and I now need to contact Cannon to have them fix the camera. Overall this has been irratating and I am now fighting with the company to get a better camera or get a refund. Needless to say I will never deal with YourDeal.com again. Very irratating.

Reviews.Title: Come on Canon!
Reviews.Author: luv2read
Reviews.Content: I've always used Canon cameras, but this one was disappointing. Although I do like the viewfinder, 2 AA batteries, and size, the image quality is low and the camera is just slow. Come on Canon!

Reviews.Title: GREAT ITEM
Reviews.Author: Diane Kalec
Reviews.Content: was very pleased with this camera. Not hard to learn how to use it. Have taken and sent pictures with ease. Like the software that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: I am having so much fun with the great point and shoot camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gregory P. Garceau "Spiritual Critic"
Reviews.Content: I am having so much fun with the new point and shoot camera.  I use it daily for my classes at the Institute of Transpersonal Psychology.  This camera fits perfectly into the camera case I ordered.  Easy to use with 8 picture viewing and video viewing settings.  Pictures are extremely clear, and of excellent quality.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who needs a great camera to take pictures or videos for class or business.  I love that all that I need is double disposable AA batteries for it. These batteries or even the rechargeable AA batteries are available in most grocery stores.  I highly recommend this camera for the price conscious person.  For further information about me and what I do, please check out my web site at [...].  I will soon be selling products and services on a registered new web site that accepts all credit cards or paypal at [...].

Reviews.Title: Cannon A1200
Reviews.Author: markdc
Reviews.Content: Good point and shoot camera.  Easy to use and produces good quality pictures.  Don't expect too much if shooting in low light.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: fish seeker
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon that I have gotten thru Amazon.  Not that the first camera had problems I just drowned it.  Got to much water in my wade fishing bucket.  The screen does not disappear in bright sunlight, takes good pictures for what I use it for. I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: L. E. Long
Reviews.Content: I use it every day and love it. If I had any complaint at all it might be that it does too much but then you don't have to get involved with all the options if you choose not to. Set it on Auto and it will shoot great photos for you.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera.
Reviews.Author: V. CARDONE
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon SX 20 (also from Amazon) with a lot of accessories, tripods, flashes....and wanted a plain camera to the beach....this was my choice because the optical viewfinder work fine under the sun and has almost the same operating system that the SX20.

Reviews.Title: Ideal for the purpose
Reviews.Author: Retired Viking
Reviews.Content: I bought these for my field crew.  We take a lot of pictures of name plates, fixtures, and what we call "context shots" as reminders of what we surveyed.  These cameras are durable enough to take banging around, but are cheap enough that when one gets broken in the field, it is not big loss.  These use two AA batteries.  While these do not last as long on a charge as a proprietary battery would, you can buy them anywhere, and if you are caught half way through the day with low batteries, you can duck into a store anywhere in the world and buy a fresh set.

Reviews.Title: A Viewfinder and AA batery use makes this one user friendly.
Reviews.Author: penny
Reviews.Content: Although this model it is older it has two very important features that I cannot find on newer models.  So I have put my new one in a drawer and this one in my purse.The most important is a viewfinder.  My newer small point and shoot cannot handle bright sunny days.The camera uses AA batteries.  Lithium batteries are lightweight and take a 4GB card for me.  A spare set of batteries is better that taking a battery charger and spare rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Only 24p digital camera in its price range.
Reviews.Author: Prammer
Reviews.Content: This camera can record 24 frames per second. If you like the look of 16mm movie film and don't want to spend a lot of money in developing and transfers, the A1200 is the next best thing. As an added bonus, animators can benefit from the ability to study video shot with it frame by frame and even rotoscope or superimpose it in their framegrabber for frame-accurate accurate timing to the audio track and what they are animating.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good and sturdy for the money
Reviews.Author: RROly
Reviews.Content: I've had a Powershot A1200 for about 18 months now, and it's held up really well to some pretty rough conditions: getting banged around, frequently shooting in the rain and high humidity, etc. It's performed well, and been very reliable. It's not made to be weatherproof, but mine's stood up to abuse.Some caveats; Shutter lag -- the time between pressing the shutter and the picture being taken -- is significant. Your timing has to be good, especially photographing kids. Do I wish the sensor was bigger? Yup. And low light performance is OK, but not great.But for the price: A great deal. I also like the old-school AA batteries and the actual viewfinder, which is something you hardly ever find on a point and shoot anymore. Color rendition's good; the lens is sharp enough, etc.The old saying is that the best camera is the one you have with you. This one's small, cheap and sturdy enough to be that camera.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as spare camera for business.
Reviews.Author: B. R. B. - AZ
Reviews.Content: The 1200 was purchased mainly as a backup camera for my business use and because like the A1300 it is one of the less expensive cameras that have a view finder. The view finder is the main reason I purchased the camera.  it works well.

Reviews.Title: Have owned several of these
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hester
Reviews.Content: I have owned several of these.  Bought extra as had the viewfinder which is no longer available.  Helpful in FL sun.  Easy, compact, good pics

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: W. Briggs IV
Reviews.Content: TOO BAD THE TRIPOD WE GOT TO GO WITH WAS NOT AS WONDERFULL, (IT WAS NEARLY USELESS) BUT THIS CAMERA IS GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: Fits my needs
Reviews.Author: Laura A. Martin
Reviews.Content: Sturdy. Captures good pictures when the photographer focuses well.Light weight and fits in my pocket for handy use. Easy on the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Irritating flaw
Reviews.Author: Alison
Reviews.Content: I had an earlier model of the Canon Powershot camera that I really loved & which worked perfectly.  After someone damaged it, I decided to replace it with this upgraded model.  At first I was very happy because this model of the camera had more functionality and a lower price than my earlier camera.  However, it quickly became apparent that this camera has a serious flaw -- for some reason it fails to recognize charged batteries and is constantly giving a "change batteries" warning, even after new, fully charged batteries are inserted. I can usually get a few shots in before the camera refuses to operate, and it is an on-going frustration. This is a flaw which others have reported as well and which I should have heeded. I am now looking for a new, non-Canon digital camera to replace this one.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ruby Slippers
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift for a novice user.  Very simple to use with the basic functions.  Has lots of extra features, too.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Cat Lady "Cat Lady"
Reviews.Content: This is my second Canon Powershot A1200 12.1 MP digital camera.  I had one for over two years but dropped it and broke it beyond repair.  I wanted the exact same camera as I was very happy with it.  You can't beat it for the money.  The indoor flash pictures are very good quality, very detailed and clear pictures inside and outside.

Reviews.Title: Excellent caamera
Reviews.Author: Phyllis C. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.  It takes good pix and fills my needs perfectly every time I use it

Reviews.Title: Good little camera with optical range finder.
Reviews.Author: Jjoek1
Reviews.Content: This little camera fit easily into my pocket, or hangs from my belt. It has a range finder which I have always preferred, and is the only camera its size with one. Often the image is not well seen on the screen when the outside lighting is bright, and I would need to put on my reading glasses to see it. This is when I find the rangefinder viewer most helpful. The camera has multiple settings, starting with a simple point and shoot. Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Why lug around a big SLR?
Reviews.Author: Vickie S. Chapman
Reviews.Content: A pocket camera with a viewfinder! Why lug around a big SLR-type when you can take most of the same pictures with this little beauty? I've blown my pictures up to poster size and even published one professionally. Takes decent videos, too, and good a recording sounds.

Reviews.Title: One of a kind!
Reviews.Author: Win Allred "Win Allred"
Reviews.Content: Nice compact size and a pretty fair range of focal lengths.  It has become my favorite "point and shoot" camera that I have owned.  One of it's best features is a view finder.  When I am shooting in bright sun it is almost impossible to compose a shot using the screen.  I find I'm using the viewfinder almost exclusively now.  I believe Canon has quit production and when I bought this one Canon had the only point and shoot with this feature.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Abdelwahab Fayez Hassan
Reviews.Content: It works nice as it should be the camera is sturdy and its consumption for batteries is adequate. The pictures are of excellent  quality

Reviews.Title: Adequate, if you can live without zoom
Reviews.Author: Wombat Ed "Wombat Ed"
Reviews.Content: OOPS!  I didn't read the fine print, and ended up with a camera that doesn't have an optical zoom.  If I was a real photo enthusiast, I would have sent it back, but it really was my mistake, and I've gotten a lot of great photos with it.

Reviews.Title: Broken, defective
Reviews.Author: David Price
Reviews.Content: Would not work right out of the box. Sent to canon for repair. Cost me extra postage and time. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my purpose
Reviews.Author: doug
Reviews.Content: At work, we need general purpose cameras like this.  Uses AA batteries (lithium), so you dont have to carry a charger and loose it in a motel room.  This A1200 is better than the later models, as it has a knob on top to do settings rather than going through a software menu.  Photo quality is fine.  It also has a real viewfinder, even though its small.  We use some three dozen of these over the years, and the Canon quality comes through.  Very few failures, even with staff that misstreats them.  I hope thse will continue to be available.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Elder
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot A1200. I bought my wife one last year and we both liked it so much that I just had to have one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Harold P. Fultz, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Bought for m y wife and she loves it. Compact, easy to use and can get a good number of shots before batteries need recharged. I recommend re-chargeable batteries, as all digital cameras are hard on batteries.

Reviews.Title: love it...
Reviews.Author: LAM...
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift...it works awesome, the pictures are clear and it's very handy becuase it's small you can just put it in your pocket...pretty cool...

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Ivan
Reviews.Content: My wife uses it most of the time but getting around the menu part is hard for older people to figure out.  It takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Always liked Canon
Reviews.Author: GLN "GLN"
Reviews.Content: Every camera I've bought in the last 20 years has been a Canon and have never gone wrong.  My daughter got this for Christmas and likes it.  Plenty of features for a small and inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot  A-1200
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: Everything you need in a Basic camera. VERY SIMPLE TO USE and Takes wonderful pictures and video. The 2 AA batteries last a long time, usually enough for 75-100 pictures.  Lightweight and fits easy into a shirt or pants pocket.  Great gift idea too.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jerry W. Rapp
Reviews.Content: This is older style camera ,so don't expect portrait quality pics. Plenty good enough for Face Book,or snap shots on your PC. I like the fact it uses two AA battery's . Easy to change when needed. I bought it to replace a HP That lasted ten years. Have not ben disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot A 1200
Reviews.Author: Gina M. Hall "ginapegasus"
Reviews.Content: I had one of these exactly like this one but am a bit disappointed with the new one. It isn't nearly as good, doesn't work as well in our on again and off again weather and is usually a bit blurry pictures.For being the same canon, this one doesn't compare to the old one.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Milford Duane Hickory Montgomery "gotfish"
Reviews.Content: I own three of these and keep on "spare" so I can gift one to my wife when she totally destroys/drops hers.  LOL.  Excellent quality and the price is right for everyday pictures which are 99.9% of those we take.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: C. Morehouse "cmoreho"
Reviews.Content: Great camera (always love Canon). Took to Play Del Carmen, and took great pictures. Then took to Yellowstone and Tetons, and no disappointments here either.  Great on battery.

Reviews.Title: Camara with this price is good
Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: I can say its good camara but not best will continue using it will it works and will see better option in future.

Reviews.Title: Fun simple camera
Reviews.Author: Doc IA "KM"
Reviews.Content: We used it in Germany. It takes really good photos and is an easy to use point and shoot camera. The resolution is impressive.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Michele A. Smith
Reviews.Content: this camera arrived in a reasonable amount of time, which we needed, and is a great little camera; and most importantly was listed at one of the lower prices I could find for it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Family of 7 with God 1st"
Reviews.Content: my 9 year old daughter loves this camera. It is great for her "experimenting" around and getting good shots. highly recommend for kids and an easy use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: Tony B.
Reviews.Content: These cameras are used everyday by our employees, indoors, outdoors, good and bad weather, etc.  Durable and takes great pictures.  Needs to be replaced only after YEARS of DAILY use!  Buy this!

Reviews.Title: Mediocre Fotos
Reviews.Author: Between2Worlds
Reviews.Content: This camera takes only mediocre fotos, not as good quality as a previous camera of fewer megapixels. However, since it is difficult to see the screen in bright sunlight, and this camera has an optical viewfinder, I kept it. Unfortunately, the optical viewfinder has almost totally disappeared from point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Video is compatible with iPad 2
Reviews.Author: Brin Mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: This very nifty camera has video capability in addition to stills. The video can be imported to the iPad 2 via the camera connection kit or directly from the SD card, or the included USB patch cord. If you can't spare the room on your iPad while you're travelling, then I strongly suggest using a cloud service such as Dropbox or iCloud. A whole bunch of still photos can be stored in a Gb of cloud storage. It's a fun little camera that has a bunch of built-in special effects to noodle around with -- even a pseudo tilt-shift! -- so the investment in the time it takes to read the manual and try all of the dials and buttons will be well worth it. I used to be an Olympus user, and those cameras have served me well, but the availability of SD cards and AA batteries while travelling combined with the abundance of fun features have really made me glad I have a Canon!

Reviews.Title: False "change batteries" message
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 15 months. It started to reject all batteries placed in it about a month ago after some intermittent problems. I should not have taken another chance with Canon because I previously had a Canon Powershot A590is that did the same thing but was older when it started doing this.I will not buy a Canon camera again.

Reviews.Title: I have bought three of these!
Reviews.Author: P. Smith "P. Smith"
Reviews.Content: I liked mine so well that hubby wanted one for himself.  Got it - and he lost it :(But again, he liked it so well that we ordered him another one.Also, it arrived the very next day!Now if he loses this one...........

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, and professional pictures
Reviews.Author: lorraine
Reviews.Content: This camera took excellent pictures of my trip to Arizona so happy I chose a Canon.Price and efficiency was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: mae benson
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot A1200 12.1MP camera is great,  more than I expected! Being able to include the Memory card and the carrying case made it so easy!!!

Reviews.Title: I can't believe its performance in the package size and price
Reviews.Author: John Baird
Reviews.Content: It fits in your shirt pocked, has super resolution, a big view screen, a flash, easy natural interface with the human, easy on the batteries, all of the photo variables control, and an optical viewfinder

Reviews.Title: great features
Reviews.Author: john wallack
Reviews.Content: The AA batteries are easy to replace anywhere. The viewfinder is easier to use than the photo display. Very sharp images.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Stacy Colussy "Stacy Colussy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for every day use.  It is easy to use and light weight.  It is not for the serious photographer but is wonderful for getting shots of the grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Sandy "Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: Nicest camera I've purchased and a great price. Takes great pictures and has the added advantage of a view finder. The manual is very basic, so I had to email Canon to find out what the setting icons meant.

Reviews.Title: A great camera to take on outings where it may get trashed
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It doesn't take bad pictures if you work with it (which can be difficult since there are no manual settings).  Bought this for Burning Man since I didn't want to ruin a good camera there and came out with some decent pics.  Not sure if this is any better than a high-end camera phone, but good for a rough environment.

Reviews.Title: Not getting the results I expected.
Reviews.Author: momski
Reviews.Content: I had SUCH high hopes for this little camera (it was the optical viewfinder AND reviews that sold me on it), but, out of the box, it's not performing as well as my old Samsung Smart Touch 7.2mp.  I've signed up for an online point-and-shoot course, so I'm hoping that the problem is just me and not the camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Rob Corujo
Reviews.Content: I had an older Canon Powershot that finally died after many years of service. My new Canon Powershot is a perfect replacement. I hope to enjoy this model as much or more than my original.

Reviews.Title: Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Perry
Reviews.Content: good camera.... really didn't work like I thought it would but it will do for now until I get a little more money to get a better one. Good for the time being... Great for a starter camera

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot A1200
Reviews.Author: JCAZ
Reviews.Content: An oldie but goody.  Reliable camera with all the necessary features for my industry.  Time and date stamp options being foremost.

Reviews.Title: So unhappy
Reviews.Author: SueBeTurtle "Turtle"
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera because I needed one for work.  I've had good luck buying used and refurbished products in the past, but I was so disappointed with this one.  It came damaged beyond product description and did not arrive on time although I paid for quick delivery.  When I emailed seller I received a snide reply that really honked me off.  Then when camera did arrive it came unable to use, an obvious defect and should not have been sent as it was.  I will say after initial snide reply, seller did ask how to make things right, and issued a quick refund.  Problem is that it was too little too late.

Reviews.Title: good camera for my son
Reviews.Author: Christopher Priano
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, the settings are straight forward, it takes very nice, crisp pictures, it is nice and small, overall very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Best compact for the money!!!
Reviews.Author: Lois E. Hunt
Reviews.Content: I dropped my last a1200 and had to get a new one. (I have dropped it 20 times with NO damage....this one was launched onto concrete and hit the wrong way!)  I use this camera every single day for work. This is a workhorse AND takes amazing pics. I take it on vacation as well. Photos matched up well with my friends VERY expensive Canon. couldn't tell the difference. she was miffed! Get this camera. Better than the a1300 since they left top controls off the 1300. Stupid. LOVE MY A1200!!!!

Reviews.Title: careful, my camera doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Violeta
Reviews.Content: I'm from Ecuador and I ordered 2 cameras, one works well and the other one simply doesn't work!!! I was very disappointed and the worst thing is that from here I can do nothing with the waranty.

Reviews.Title: Best little Point an Shoot
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: One of the few cameras of this type that has a view finder that actually zooms. This allows you to turn off the screen, saving batteries, when the sun is behind you and making it hard to see the screen. 12.1 MP is excellent for everyday shooting and makes beautiful enlargements. Well worth the money. Planing to buy another one as a back up.

Reviews.Title: OMG!!!........This Canon Power Shot A1200 is GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: William Tony
Reviews.Content: I can take great pictures,videos! The software that comes with this purchase,makes it easy to download pictures or videos to your desktop/laptop computer effortlessly.

Reviews.Title: just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I dropped my other camera and needed to buy something.  I decided on this camera because I wanted a rangefinder, and in reality a simple point and shoot camera.  It also has a strap, so I am unlikely to drop this one.  I used to have way more complicated cameras, but this is just perfect for my needs now.

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: CAYRA LUGO
Reviews.Content: Canon Poweshot  A 1200 12.1 MP DIGITAL CAMERA ES UN producto QUE  cubre con las expectativas vendidas. Llegó en buen estado.

Reviews.Title: Pics came out grainy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Returned this camera for a Sony DSC-WX150. Much better photos and zoom. I would not buy this again. It is worth spending more for better quality.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: bradwyatt83
Reviews.Content: takes great pictures for a good price. dont expect this thing to take pictures like a $300 camera cause it wont. but if you want good pictures of kids one there birthday or a trip to the zoo. this is your camera. it also takes AA batteries so you dont have to deal with recharging if the battery dies. just pop two new ones in and your off.

Reviews.Title: I can't rate it yet.
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Wyman
Reviews.Content: I really haven't had a chance to use this camera yet, but it seems to have all the features I like.

Reviews.Title: Very good.
Reviews.Author: GreenGlenn
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for 2 years now and it's still working! Although lately the colors are way off, whether it's on auto or program mode. but still this is a great point&shoot; camera.  Would last a long time if you take care of it.

Reviews.Title: Very fun camera
Reviews.Author: Taz
Reviews.Content: This camera stood out for me because of the viewfinder. It comes in handy. It is a great camera. Very easy to use and great quality pics. For me has more bells and whistles than I even know how to use, but is still easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Just the camera I wanted
Reviews.Author: Larry Foster "Lance Eagle"
Reviews.Content: This camera is full of features, and one of the last of the genre to offer both a view finder and a screen.  I found it on Amazon for $99; I challenge anyone to find a better camera for less than $200.  I like its compactness, and it is very comfortable and secure in my hand.

Reviews.Title: Super shot
Reviews.Author: June Ward
Reviews.Content: Good price, superb shots. Picture perfect pictures at reasonable price. Clean memorable times with click and zoom features. Every element of object is shown with every shot. Camera worth buying and being happy with.

Reviews.Title: It's a Canon; stuuuupid..................
Reviews.Author: Dragoslav T. Marcovich
Reviews.Content: Canon quality, easy to use, and best of all IT HAS A SEE THROUGH VIEWFINDER for those super bright beach days when the screen is invisible. One heck-of-a-deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Bought this to take pics of my new granddaughter and find that I am taking pics of everything!  Great quality, easy to use, love it!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: D. Perley
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  It is so hard to find one with a real viewfinder unless you go high end (like G15).

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot a Winner
Reviews.Author: Jan G., Grimm "California"
Reviews.Content: Who's surprised?  A great little camera.  I researched cameras, including use of my Consumer Reports membership.  I paid under $100 for this camera because it is a three year old model.  So, I got a great camera for a third  the price of the updated versions, which are basically the same.  An excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: M. Seeley
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a similar, older Canin camera, that didn't take pictures very well either. But....1) The newer version no longer comes with a rechargable battery pack. You WILL need rechargeable batteries.2) This is bigger and thicker than my old camera, due to the AA batteries required.3) It doesn't comes with a memory card (what the ?). It is, of course, useless without memory. So, factor that into the price too!Worst of all - it didn't pictures any better than my old camera!I sent it right back.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with surely isolated flaw.
Reviews.Author: Cesar
Reviews.Content: This was a great camera and I loved using it on my trip to Jerusalem. However, I had to return it for a refund because it was defective. I purchased a pack of double-A batteries for when the original batteries that came with it died. However, the camera for some reason kept showing me "low battery" and died when I put the new batteries in. I thought I had bought faulty batteries so I checked them on other electronics and they showed to be in full capacity. It was then I realized that there was something wrong with the camera itself. However, the original batteries powered through for one more week (the trip lasted for two), so it was just like Hanukkah!

Reviews.Title: BEst darn little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: P. Klinger "PKlinger"
Reviews.Content: This isn't my main camera, it's the one that goes with me "everywhere". In my pocket, always, on trips, in the car, camping, on walks... everywhere. It's the good quality, fun, pocket camera. Here's why I bought this model.1) Uses standard AA batteries, available at almost any store. Not some special Mfg. re-chargeable. (although I do use Ni-MH and have a second set with me)2) Viewfinder. I really don't want to be holding my camera up at arms length and it's really easy to see what you are going to get in motion or Sunlight.3) Built in flash (not a pop up)4) Takes nice pictures, offers some interesting settings, One I use most often after P is Discreet, which is actually "No Flash" easy enough to figure that out?Honorable Mention: 720p HD video which if you think about it, beats Hi-8mm tape for reliability and easy grabbing a small unit. It's a function and feature, this is not a Video Unit.What, discontinued? Well the A1400 is pretty much the same camera with a dedicated Movie button on the back. For the price and the results, either one is a perfect fit in my pocket.Before this I used an A400 for many years, which I retired and is still sitting on the desk for those quick online sale ads or snaps around the office. That one took a beating in my pocket, camping, travel, and the car for six years! My main camera is a Canon DSLR. But I always have a small pocket camera with me for those unexpected shots. Just crushes any cell phone shots at this point.

Reviews.Title: good basic digital camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Kim
Reviews.Content: this is a good basic digital camera ; can't ask for same quality as those thousand dollar cameras but beats using a cellphone camera

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Billy Voliva
Reviews.Content: I have had one of these cameras for a long time and this was a Christmas gift to my Granddaughter. They are great and simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Okay for outdoorsy people
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Can't complain since it was very cheap but it takes ugly pictures inside. the zoom is a little disappointing but pictures taken outdoors look beautiful. Overall, it's a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Some nice features
Reviews.Author: Coloradogirl
Reviews.Content: Overall I like the camera. However, I have found that changing the megapixels and the ISO makes for better pictures if you are not planning on making large prints. The view finder is great! No worries about composing your shot in bright sunlight. Being able to turn off the view screen really saves on batteries too. I'm still playing with color saturation levels as I have been a bit disappointed in that regard. All in all a nice little camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: decent digital camera
Reviews.Author: comunletrs
Reviews.Content: It is a good enough digital camera. The record feature is very useful and great looking. I am unimpressed with the pictures, it takes pictures like a cheap digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Good entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory S-S
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 13 year old daughter and she loves it. Has decent quality pictures and video features which she uses quite a bit. Good value for money but it is an entry level knock about camera in my estimation.

Reviews.Title: Canon digital camera
Reviews.Author: Just Linda
Reviews.Content: I love this digital camera. It has a viewfinder (hard to find on most models), it takes great pictures, and is so simple to use!

Reviews.Title: classroom camera
Reviews.Author: trynewthings
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera for it's price. The photos turn out really nice. You can take it to another country if you don't want to worry about recharging your battery. I use it in my classroom and all the photos turn out really nice.

Reviews.Title: I like the "Canon PowerShot A1100 IS" Better
Reviews.Author: V. O. Ritter
Reviews.Content: I have a "Canon PowerShot A1100 IS" and one of these "Canon PowerShot A1200 HD" cameras.  I have taken thousands of good pictures with the A1100 and almost 100 with the newer A1200. I purchased the A1200 as insurance for the day my A1100 finally quits working.  They are basically the same camera, with an optical viewfinder that I prefer, but the A1200 has more plastic.  They are both "Pocket Cameras" to carry in a shirt pocket or purse for snapshot opportunities. The biggest difference is the placement of the shutter button.  On the A1100 the shutter button is located on the extreme right side of the camera top and can be easily pressed. On the A1200, Canon has switched the position of the Mode Dial and the Shutter Button.  To take a picture using the A1200 you must "arch" your finger over the top of the Mode Dial to press the Shutter Button.  I find this uncomfortable and it does not have a natural feel when gripping the camera. I have posted a picture illustrating the old & new control positions.

Reviews.Title: Image Quality
Reviews.Author: BGL
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for a child & tested it when it arrived. I was not impressed with the image quality.I've used 2 other newer PowerShot models (in the $130 range) and there is no comparison.The image quality of this model is more like an old 7MP camera.I do not recommend this camera & would put its value more in the $40-$50 range.At this price range ($80-$90) you're better off with an equally or better rated alternative.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for my child
Reviews.Author: RailFan65
Reviews.Content: I wanted a nice but relatively inexpensive digital camera that used AA batteries and SD cards.  AA batteries as they're easy to buy and replace and SD cards as I have a bunch of them already.  It takes good pictures, up to 4"x6" I'd say.  Flash seems basic (good for about 15 feet indoors depending on existing lighting).  Battery life has been OK so far, no worse than any other AA based digital camera.  I like that I can change some of the settings (i.e. resolution) so the JPEGs aren't so big.  The kids were filling the digital cards quickly until I rolled back some of the settings.  It's been working fine.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: I love this camera - it's simple to use, and light weight, and takes AA batteries (which can be purchased in any country, and no need to travel with a battery recharger)

Reviews.Title: Great pictures.
Reviews.Author: J. Edgins
Reviews.Content: Great pictures.  Also, easy to use and the viewfinder helps greatly in bright sunlight.  The various scenery options also help.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my needs.  Wanted a point & shoot, with viewfinder for sunny days.  Also wanted a digital that takes regular "AA" batteries.  This little Canon takes great pictures for my needs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera but has file format limitations
Reviews.Author: Charla A. Hamill "mad hattie"
Reviews.Content: This camera has everything I wanted except the ability to select file formats like the TIFF or RAW formats. There is only one still image format which is JPEG (or MOV for movies). If you want to do further manipulation of still images in a software program, results are always better if you can begin with an uncompressed image.Having said that, I find the quality of the jpeg images are excellent.Everything else about this camera exceeded my expectations for versatility and control.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Work Camer
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey D. Lowrey
Reviews.Content: I only use this camera for home inspections and only on the lowest resolution, but I love it.  It's a tough little camera (I dropped it off a roof and it still worked great) and really easy to use.  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Kat MM "napaaqtuk"
Reviews.Content: This was my third Canon PowerShot, so I had high hopes. Unfortunately it hasn't lived up to my expectations.Pros:--Lightweight and small, so it fits in my pockets--Big LCD screen for reviewing shots--Face-finding and focusing technology--Preview of shot allows for quick review/erasing--Vivid coloring option really does accent the coloring of the pictures. Nice touch.--Uses just 2AA batteries...I use rechargeable batteries and they last a long time.Cons:--Overexposed shots. I've played with the settings exhaustively and still have over-exposed shots. This is especially an issue with faces, for whatever reason. Faces tend to turn on looking overly white.--Auto light detection doesn't work so well. I've had to manually change the light settings several times. I've had several oddly colored pictures as a result.--Auto and Easy settings result in poor quality pictures. My A95 easy setting was exactly that...shots came out nicely nearly every time. I don't use the auto or easy settings on this camera at all because the shots almost never come out right--Doesn't handle low-light well. And by low light, I mean you only have 2-75 watt lightbulbs on in the room. Ugh. Shots in "low-light" conditions come out blurry and the coloring is off.--Many many many blurry shots.I've toyed with sending this back, and still might.

Reviews.Title: Excellent.
Reviews.Author: Bonnie Coley
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't beat it.  Will recommend it to anybody.  It is an exellent product and I like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Alena W.
Reviews.Content: It's a Canon. So of course it's great. Really easy features and menu. Even has a beginners feature in case you're new to digital cameras. Picture quality is crisp and clear. Lightweight and very easily portable. I would have preferred a rechargeable battery but that can be easily remedied by buying rechargeable. On the plus side, AA batteries are often more easily found than an outlet to charge a rechargeable.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jessica Thurston "omnipresentminded"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for my mother-in-law as a gift. She never had used a digital camera before, so i thought this was the perfect camera for her. She picked up on how to use it quickly and uses it often. It was a very good purchase for the use that she needed. I would recommend this camera to anyone who needs an easy to use digital camera. A pro of this camera is it easily can fit in your purse.

Reviews.Title: This isn't an SLR but the closet thing to it!  And the price is fabulous...
Reviews.Author: Patricia
